required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Human Albumin and Anastomotic Leakage After Gastric Cancer Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Human Albumin With Anastomotic Leakage After Gastric Cancer Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: We investigate whether the intravenously administered human albumin is beneficial to prevent anastomotic leakage after gastric cancer surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
Anastomotic leakage after gastric cancer surgery is not very common but it is a very critical postoperative complication. Anastomotic leakage severely compromises the recovery after surgery. It increases the overall burden of patients and hospital resources. Postoperative mortality is higher in patients with anastomotic leakage.
Human albumin is routinely administered after surgery with a unproven hypothesis that the human albumin is beneficial to prevent anastomotic leakage. We investigate whether the intravenously administered human albumin is beneficial to prevent anastomotic leakage after gastric cancer surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of the rate of anastomotic leakage
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one months after the discharge of last patient
primary_outcome.description: The rate of anastomotic leakage were compared among both groups

arm_group.description: Patients who received intravenous human albumin after gastric cancer surgery
Patients who did not receive intravenous human albumin after gastric cancer surgery

intervention.description: Patients received intravenous human albumin after gastric cancer surgery. Overall quantity of human albumin were recorded.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with gastric cancer who underwent gastrectomy with adequate lymph node dissection.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed gastric cancer
- Patients who underwent radical gastrectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient who did not undergo gastrectomy
